readResourceFile

public static java.lang.String[] readResourceFile(java.lang.String path)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
Reads a text file from a resource file in the local classpath and returns an array with the lines of the file.

Parameters:
path - Path to the file.
Returns:
Returns an array with names of mappings files. If the resource file is not found, then returns null.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readResourceFile

public static java.lang.String[] readResourceFile(java.lang.String path,
                                                  boolean excludeEmptyLines,
                                                  boolean excludeSharps)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
Reads a text file from a resource file in the local classpath and returns an array with the lines of the file.

Parameters:
path - Path to the file.
excludeEmptyLines - If set to true, empty lines will be excluded.
excludeSharps - If true, anything that follows a '#' in a line is ignored
Returns:
Returns an array with names of mappings files. If the resource file is not found, then returns null.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getStringFromResourceFile

public static java.lang.String getStringFromResourceFile(java.lang.String path)
Gets a String from a resource file. New line characters are replaced by spaces. If the file is not found, a RuntimeException is thrown.

Parameters:
path - Path to the resource file.
Returns:
Returns the string in the resource file.

getFileContents

public static byte[] getFileContents(java.lang.String path,
                                     boolean inClassPath)
Gets the contents of a file.

Parameters:
path - Path.
inClassPath - If this is true, then the path must point to a resource file in the class path, otherwise the path must point to a file.
Returns:
Returns a byte array that contains the file contents.

Creates a File object for a path.

Parameters:
path - Path.
inClassPath - If this is true, then the path must point to a resource file in the class path, otherwise the path must point to a file.
